Pre-Game Insights: Both Ecuador and Venezuela will be bidding to get their respective 2024 Copa America campaigns off to positive starts when they lock horns at the competition on Saturday.
Ecuador will be bidding to progress past the group stage of the Copa America for their second tournament in a row.
Ecuador have never won the Copa America, but they have finished fourth on two previous occasions - in 1959 and 1993.
Ecuador will enter this match off the back of successive wins, beating Bolivia and Honduras in their friendlies earlier this month.
Sanchez's side have made a positive start to their 2026 World Cup qualification section, collecting eight points from six matches.
Venezuela have not actually been in action since a goalless draw with Guatemala at the end of March.
Fernando Batista's side were last victorious against Chile in October 2023.
Venezuela have also made a solid start to their 2026 World Cup qualification campaign, sitting fourth, one point and one spot above Ecuador.
There has not been much to choose between these two sides in their recent meetings, with both winning one of their last six matches, and the other four games ending in draws.
The two teams last locked horns in a 2026 World Cup qualifier in November 2023, with the score finishing level, but Ecuador did beat Venezuela 1-0 at the end of 2021.
